The basic parameters that characterize epidemic spreading are the epidemic threshold λ c and the infection density ρ. If the effective infection rate λ is above the threshold, λ≥ λ
c , then the epidemic will spread and the system will ultimately have a non-zero steady-state infection density ( ρ > 0). By contrast, when λ< λ
c , the epidemic will die out ( ρ = 0).
